Recording the Toll of Atomic Bombs

By the end of 1945, the atomic bombs had killed an estimated 214,000 people in Japan.

To remember the victims, Hiroshima and Nagasaki began keeping lists of people killed by the bombs.

August 1945

The United States drops atomic bombs

on Hiroshima and Nagasaki

2018

493,344 total recorded as killed

The most recent data as of August 5, 2019

1968

90,426 total recorded as killed

Nagasaki city creates its list of

people killed in the bombing of Nagasaki

400,000

Nagasaki

300,000

1952

57,902 recorded as killed

Hiroshima city creates a list of

people killed in the bombing of Hirsohima

200,000

Hiroshima

100,000

1945

1955

1985

1995

2015

2005

1965

1975

Sources: Hiroshima and Nagasaki city hall

Notes: Each city hall keeps a list of people who were killed by bombs dropped on their respective cities.

Note: sRelatives of the deceased apply to the city halls to register the deaths. Many victims are unidentified, and the lists do not include everyone

Note: swho was killed by the atomic bombs.

Recording the Toll of Atomic Bombs

In August 1945, the United States dropped atomic bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki.

By the end of 1945, the bombs had killed an estimated 214,000 people.

To remember the victims, Hiroshima and Nagasaki began keeping lists of those killed by the bombs.

1952

57,902 recorded as killed

Hiroshima city creates a list of people killed in the bombing of Hiroshima

1968

90,426 total recorded as killed

Nagasaki city creates its list of people killed in the bombing of Nagasaki

2018

493,344 total recorded as killed

The most recent data as of August 5, 2019

Sources: Hiroshima and Nagasaki city hall

Notes: Each city hall keeps a list of people who were killed by bombs dropped on their respective cities.

Note: sRelatives of the deceased apply to the city halls to register the deaths. Many victims are unidentified,

Note: s and the lists do not include everyone who was killed by the atomic bombs.
